page.title: 14FARMING, HEALTH
page.content: owner C. Rice on sloping ground mostly 'free drainage'. Keeps 60 beef cattle & 150 sheep.{Kempland Fm}of 72 ha. Pig farm with subsidiary beef and sheep on partially sloping ground. Run by G.D. Fuller with 2 men. One major disadvan- tage is the inability of heavy vehicle to get to the farm!{Stone Barton Fm}A dairy fm of 130 ha. Keeps 120 cows with 100 stock replacement 60 bullocks & 500 store lambs - fattened in autumn Family farm in 19 Century, sold and repurchased in l970. Run by R.E.G. Webber with 3 men - 1 part-time.{ {HEALTH}With some 1 in 4 our settlement population over the age of 65 the major health problem is that of old age. Certainly residents consider that the doctors and facilities we have are outstanding! The Health Centre, beside the Secondary School, northern end of South Molton St, is at present in a
